channel.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
channel.description:
These are decompiled client.javas all from the same source renamed with pd's factor <3
clientjad.java is obviously decompiled with jad clientgnu.java is decompiled with jode's gnu option clientsun.java is decompiled with jode's sun option
what looks the best/is easiest to understand in your opinion?

item.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

Krichevskoy:

JODE can handle some things that JAD can't (mostly control flow) and JAD can handle some things that JODE can't (mostly exception errors). When it works, I like JODE's naming better, but JAD gets control flow more logically...so I use a combination of the two 

(((Class26) someClass26).someInt ^ 0xffffffff)

but instead:

~someClass26.someInt

It's a real hassle to write a regex to clean up behind what JODE does there. Maybe some fancy IDE can do it, but I don't own any. After spending an hour reading through what JODE produces, this begins to border on a trump card for using JAD in my eyes. Almost.

Read full topic

item.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

JODE can handle some things that JAD can't (mostly control flow) and JAD can handle some things that JODE can't (mostly exception errors). When it works, I like JODE's naming better, but JAD gets control flow more logically...so I use a combination of the two

edit: Last sentence is supposed to have JAD & JODE reversed.

item.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

While I know hardly anything about this, I have heard people recommending JAD at a few places non-rs related though.

I am not going to vote since I have no way of backing this up.

Read full topic

item.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Pwnd:

JAD totally owns all of them.

pfft

JAD can't properly decompile the RuneScape client without some serious manual editing.

I do really hate JODE's local variable renaming though. I edited mine to remove the underscores.

Read full topic

JAD totally owns all of them.
Nice renamer
Better than Zmk, unless that, of course, is his

item.title: Which decompiler makes cleaner code?
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Gnu's... got to this just hitting the page down key... so its out for sure...

	if (string_0_.length () > 0)
	  strings[i_1_++] = string_0_.toLowerCase ();
	anInt862 = 0;
	if (i != 2)
	  aBoolean959 = ! aBoolean959;
      while_12_:
	for (int i_4_ = 0; i_4_ < ItemDef.totalItems; i_4_++)
	  {
	    ItemDef itemdef = ItemDef.forID (i_4_);
	    if (itemdef.certTemplateID == -1 && itemdef.name != null)
	      {
		String string_5_ = itemdef.name.toLowerCase ();
		for (int i_6_ = 0; i_6_ < i_1_; i_6_++)
		  {
		    if (string_5_.indexOf (strings[i_6_]) == -1)
		      continue while_12_;

Let me look at the others and edit this post. Remove if you want, but figuring its ok since you attached them????

Suns does the same thing...
